title: Takahiro Kawamura
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Kawamura was born in <a href="Shimada%2C%20Shizuoka">Shimada</a> on October 4, 1979. He joined <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="J%C3%BAbilo%20Iwata">Júbilo Iwata</a> from youth team in 1998. He also moved to Argentine club <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20River%20Plate">River Plate</a> on loan in 1999. He played many matches as mainly defensive midfielder from 2001 and the club won the champions <a href="2002%20J.League%20Division%201">2002 J1 League</a> and <a href="2003%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">2003 Emperor's Cup</a>. However his opportunity to play decreased in 2005. In 2006, he moved to <a href="Cerezo%20Osaka">Cerezo Osaka</a>. Although he played many matches, the club was relegated to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> end of 2006 season. In 2007, he moved to <a href="Kawasaki%20Frontale">Kawasaki Frontale</a>. Although he could not play many matches, the club won the 2nd place <a href="2007%20J.League%20Cup">2007 J.League Cup</a>. In 2008, he returned to Júbilo Iwata. However he could not play many matches. In 2009, he moved to J2 club Tokyo Verdy and he played many matches. From 2010, he moved Thailand and played for <a href="Police%20United%20F.C.">Police United</a> (2010), <a href="TOT%20S.C.">TOT</a> (2011–15) and <a href="Police%20Tero%20F.C.">BEC Tero Sasana</a> (2016). He retired end of 2016 season.
